metadata.title: CVE-2022-41860 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In freeradius, when an EAP-SIM supplicant sends an unknown SIM option, theserver will try to look that option up in the internal dictionaries. Thislookup will fail, but the SIM code will not check for that failure.Instead, it will dereference a NULL pointer, and cause the server to crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41860` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeradius - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
freeradius-common - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
freeradius-config - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
freeradius-dhcp - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
freeradius-iodbc - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
freeradius-krb5 - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
freeradius-ldap - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
freeradius-memcached - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
freeradius-mysql - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
freeradius-postgresql - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
freeradius-python3 - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
freeradius-redis - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
freeradius-rest - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
freeradius-utils - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
freeradius-yubikey - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
libfreeradius3 - 3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freeradius package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.26~dfsg~git20220223.1.00ed0241fa-0ubuntu3').
